DOC.brief_title: Computerized-Adaptive Testing : Feasibility In Women With Pelvic Floor Disorders ( CAT )
DOC.detailed_description: Patient-reported outcome ( PRO 's ) important ass treatment progress field pelvic floor disorder ( PFDs ) , include urinary incontinence , pelvic organ prolapse , fecal incontinence . The NIH invest Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement System ( PROMIS ) revolutionize PRO measure . To date , PROMIS instrument feasibility acceptability PROMIS Computerized-Adaptive Testing ( CAT ) technology well explored woman PFDs warrant investigation . In recruit sixty woman , investigator conduct pilot-testing CAT mode PROMIS questionnaire , compare participant 's attitude paper short-forms versus CAT mode administration . The investigator recruit 60 woman UI participate study . Participants ask complete paper CAT version PROMIS questionnaires cover physical , social mental health domain ( Appendix 1 ) . The time take complete version record . After complete questionnaire , participant interview , include brief `` Usability Satisfaction Questionnaire '' ( Appendix 2 ) , question technical problem , preference , acceptability mode .
